description:
Upon finishing the game there's no visual indicator for whether the puzzle was finished correctly. This might be caused by the KDE desktop I am running versus the game itself seeming to be GTK based?

Either how, that kinda dulls the experience greatly despite everything else working fine.
summary: Nice list of puzzles, but no validation

description: If it checks, I can't find it.

I love Griddlers/ Nonograms/ ... and so I was looking forwards to this program.
There is a way of finding if the grid is correct - checking the "tick" at the top right.
My criticisms are really three fold. One is that there isn't an obvious way to import new - or home made puzzles.
The number of puzzles is very limited, and doesn't (from my limited experience) have any puzzles of e.g. real objects - they seem just random images.
If there was an obvious library, then people would contribute, and the library would grow, and this program would be more fun to use.
summary: Mixed sentiments - it works, but is so limited one gets bored quickly

description: Installed on ubuntu 20.04 and it won't run :(

The puzzles themselves are random pixel distributions; they vary in difficulty and are a good progression. But it's a onetime game; once complete, you can just see the random images you decoded.

I liked it, but the interface could stand improvement; you're using a single button to switch squares between three states and I found myself clicking repeatedly, especially if I made a mistake. A "reset the board" option would be very useful. The "ghost mode" comes in very useful in the later puzzles and somewhat makes up for the lack of an "undo" function.
summary: Good puzzles but UI could stand improvement

description: Comment on fait pour mettre des croix et valider?

Jeu très léger et vraiment sympa.

Pour ceux qui se demandent comment mettre des croix, il faut cliquer à nouveau sur la case, et comment valider, lorsque vous avez complété la grille le bouton "ghost mode" en haut à droite se transforme en "valider".
